analyzed: thera vāda vinaya

analyzed: mahāvibhaṅga  nissaggiya kaṇḍa
translated: The Great Analysis🔽The Chapter on Forfeiture

original: 10. Rājasikkhāpada
analyzed: rāja sikkhāpada
translated: The training rule on royal

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato upanandassa sakyaputtassa upaṭṭhāko mahāmatto āyasmato upanandassa sakyaputtassa dūtena cīvaracetāpannaṁ pāhesi—
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena āyasmataḥ upanandassa sakya puttassa upaṭṭhākaḥ mahāmattaḥ āyasmataḥ upanandassa sakya puttassa dūtena cīvara cetāpannam pāhesi
translated: On one occasion a high official who was a supporter of Venerable Upananda the Sakyan sent a messenger to give a robe fund to Upananda, saying,

original: “iminā cīvaracetāpannena cīvaraṁ cetāpetvā ayyaṁ upanandaṁ cīvarena acchādehī”ti.
analyzed: iminā cīvara cetā āpannena cīvaram cetā apetvā ayyam upanandam cīvarena acchādehi iti
translated: “Buy a robe with this robe fund and give it to Venerable Upananda.”

original: Atha kho so dūto yenāyasmā upanando sakyaputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ upanandaṁ sakyaputtaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho saḥ dūtaḥ yena āyasmai upanandaḥ sakya putto tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam upanandam sakya puttam etat avoca
translated: The messenger then went to Upananda and said,

original: “idaṁ kho, bhante, āyasmantaṁ uddissa cīvaracetāpannaṁ ābhataṁ.
analyzed: idam kho bhante āyasmantam uddissa cīvara cetā āpannam ābhata
translated: “Venerable, this robe fund has been given to you.

original: Paṭiggaṇhātu āyasmā cīvaracetāpannan”ti.
analyzed: paṭiggaṇhātu
translated: Please accept it.”

original: Evaṁ vutte āyasmā upanando sakyaputto taṁ dūtaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: evam vutte āyasmai upanandaḥ sakya putto tam dūtam etat avoca
translated: Upananda replied,

original: “na kho mayaṁ, āvuso, cīvaracetāpannaṁ paṭiggaṇhāma, cīvarañca kho mayaṁ paṭiggaṇhāma kālena kappiyan”ti.
analyzed: na kho maye āvuso cīvara cetāpannam paṭiggaṇhāma cīvaram ca kho mayam paṭiggaṇhāma kālena kappiyanti
translated: “We don’t accept a robe fund, but we do accept a robe at the right time.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, so dūto āyasmantaṁ upanandaṁ sakyaputtaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: evam vutte saḥ dūtaḥ āyasmantam upanandam sakya puttam etat avoca
translated: The messenger said to Upananda,

original: “atthi panāyasmato koci veyyāvaccakaro”ti?
analyzed: atthi pana āyasmataḥ koci
translated: “But does Venerable Upananda have someone who can do the service?”

original: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro upāsako ārāmaṁ agamāsi kenacideva karaṇīyena.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aññataraḥ upāsakaḥ ārāmam agamāsi kenacid eva karaṇīyena
translated: On that occasion a lay follower had come to the monastery on some business.

original: Atha kho āyasmā upanando sakyaputto taṁ dūtaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai upanandaḥ sakya putto tam dūtam etat avoca
translated: Upananda said to the messenger,

original: “eso kho, āvuso, upāsako bhikkhūnaṁ veyyāvaccakaro”ti.
analyzed: esaḥ kho āvuso upāsakaḥ bhikkhūnam veyyāvaccakaroti
translated: “This lay follower here can do the service for the monks.”

original: Atha kho so dūto taṁ upāsakaṁ saññāpetvā yenāyasmā upanando sakyaputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ upanandaṁ sakyaputtaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho saḥ dūtaḥ tam upāsakam saññāpetvā yena āyasmai upanandaḥ sakya putto tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam upanandam sakya puttam etat avoca
translated: The messenger then instructed the lay follower and went to Upananda, saying,

original: “yaṁ kho, bhante, āyasmā veyyāvaccakaraṁ niddisi saññatto so mayā.
analyzed: yam kho bhante āyasmai veyyāvaccakaram niddisi saññattaḥ saḥ mayā
translated: “Sir, I’ve instructed the lay follower you mentioned.

original: Upasaṅkamatu āyasmā kālena, cīvarena taṁ acchādessatī”ti.
analyzed: upasaṅkamatu āyasmā kālena cīvarena tam acchādessati iti
translated: Please come at the right time, and he’ll give you a robe.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena so mahāmatto āyasmato upanandassa sakyaputtassa santike dūtaṁ pāhesi—
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena saḥ mahāmattaḥ āyasmataḥ upanandassa sakya puttassa santike dūtam pāhesi
translated: At that time the government official sent a message to Venerable Upananda:

original: “paribhuñjatu ayyo taṁ cīvaraṁ, icchāma mayaṁ ayyena taṁ cīvaraṁ paribhuttan”ti.
analyzed: paribhuñjatu ayyaḥ tam cīvare icchāma mayam ayyena tam cīvaram
translated: “Venerable, please use that robe-cloth. We want you to use it.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā upanando sakyaputto taṁ upāsakaṁ na kiñci avacāsi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai upanandaḥ sakya putto tam upāsakam na kiñci
translated: But Upananda said nothing in reply.

original: Dutiyampi kho so mahāmatto āyasmato upanandassa sakyaputtassa santike dūtaṁ pāhesi—🔽“paribhuñjatu ayyo taṁ cīvaraṁ, icchāma mayaṁ ayyena taṁ cīvaraṁ paribhuttan”ti.🔽Dutiyampi kho āyasmā upanando sakyaputto taṁ upāsakaṁ na kiñci avacāsi.
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho saḥ mahāmattaḥ āyasmataḥ upanandassa sakya puttassa santike dūtam pāhesi  paribhuñjatu ayyaḥ tam cīvare icchāma mayam ayyena tam cīvaram  dutiyam pi kho āyasmai upanandaḥ sakya putto tam upāsakam na kiñci
translated: A second time the government official sent a message to Upananda,

original: Tatiyampi kho so mahāmatto āyasmato upanandassa sakyaputtassa santike dūtaṁ pāhesi—🔽“paribhuñjatu ayyo taṁ cīvaraṁ, icchāma mayaṁ ayyena taṁ cīvaraṁ paribhuttan”ti.
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho saḥ mahāmattaḥ āyasmataḥ upanandassa sakya puttassa santike dūtam pāhesi  paribhuñjatu ayyaḥ tam cīvare icchāma mayam ayyena tam cīvaram
translated: and a third time he did the same.

original: Tena kho pana samayena negamassa samayo hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena negamassa samayaḥ hoti
translated: At that time the people of the town had gathered.

original: Negamena ca katikā katā hoti— “yo pacchā āgacchati paññāsaṁ baddho”ti.
analyzed: negamena ca katikā katā hoti yaḥ pacchā āgacchati paññāsam baddho ti
translated: And a rule had been made that anyone who came after the distribution would be fined fifty coins.

original: Atha kho āyasmā upanando sakyaputto yena so upāsako tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā taṁ upāsakaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai upanandaḥ sakya puttaḥ yena saḥ upāsakaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā tam upāsakam etat avoca
translated: Then Venerable Upananda went to that lay follower and said,

original: “attho me, āvuso, cīvarenā”ti.
analyzed: atthaḥ me āvuso cīvarena ati
translated: “I need a robe-cloth.”

original: “Ajjaṇho, bhante, āgamehi, ajja negamassa samayo.
analyzed: ajjaṇhaḥ bhante āgamehi ajja negamassa samayaḥ
translated: “Please wait until tomorrow, Venerable. Tomorrow is the distribution day.

original: Negamena ca katikā katā hoti—‘yo pacchā āgacchati paññāsaṁ baddho’”ti.
analyzed: negamena ca katikā katā hotiyo pacchā āgacchati paññāsam baddho ti
translated: And a rule has been made that anyone who comes after the distribution will be fined fifty coins.”

original: “Ajjeva me, āvuso, cīvaraṁ dehī”ti ovaṭṭikāya parāmasi.
analyzed: ajja iva me āvuso cīvaram dehi iti ovaṭṭikāya parāmasi
translated: “Give me a robe-cloth today.” And he grabbed the lay follower’s arm.

original: Atha kho so upāsako āyasmatā upanandena sakyaputtena nippīḷiyamāno āyasmato upanandassa sakyaputtassa cīvaraṁ cetāpetvā pacchā agamāsi.🔽Manussā taṁ upāsakaṁ etadavocuṁ—
analyzed: atha kho saḥ upāsakaḥ āyasmatā upanandena sakya puttena nippīḷiyamānaḥ āyasmataḥ upanandassa sakya puttassa cīvaram cetāpetvā pacchā agamāsi  manussā tam upāsakam etat avocuḥ
translated: Because he was pressured by Upananda, that lay follower bought a robe-cloth for Upananda and then went to the distribution.

original: “kissa tvaṁ, ayyo, pacchā āgato, paññāsaṁ jīnosī”ti.
analyzed: kissa tva ayyo pacchā āgato paññāsam jīnosi iti
translated: People asked him why he had come so late and why he had been fined fifty coins.

original: Atha kho so upāsako tesaṁ manussānaṁ etamatthaṁ ārocesi.
analyzed: atha kho saḥ upāsakaḥ tesam manussānam etam attham ārocesi
translated: He told them what had happened.

original: Manussā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: manussāḥ ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: People criticized and complained and spread it about,

original: “mahicchā ime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā asantuṭṭhā.
analyzed: mahicchāḥ ime samaṇā sakyaputtiyāḥ a santuṭṭhā
translated: “These Sakyan monastics are greedy and not content.

original: Nayimesaṁ sukaraṁ veyyāvaccampi kātuṁ.🔽Kathañhi nāma āyasmā upanando upāsakena—
analyzed: sukaram kātu  katham hi nāma āyasmai upanandaḥ upāsakena
translated: It’s not easy to do service for them.🔽How could Venerable Upananda not come when asked by a lay follower

original: ‘ajjaṇho, bhante, āgamehī’ti vuccamāno nāgamessatī”ti.
analyzed: ajjaṇhaḥ bhante āgamehi iti vuccamānaḥ na āgamessati iti
translated: to do a service for him?”

original: Assosuṁ kho bhikkhū tesaṁ manussānaṁ ujjhāyantānaṁ khiyyantānaṁ vipācentānaṁ.
analyzed: assosum kho bhikkhū tesam manussānam ujjhāyantānam khiyyantānam vipācentāna
translated: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

original: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: ye te bhikkhū appicchā pe te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

original: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā upanando sakyaputto upāsakena—
analyzed: katham hi nāma āyasmai upanandaḥ sakya putto upāsakena
translated: “How could Venerable Upananda not come when asked by a lay follower

original: ‘ajjaṇho, bhante, āgamehī’ti vuccamāno nāgamessatī”ti.🔽Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṁ upanandaṁ sakyaputtaṁ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ …pe…
analyzed: ajjaṇhaḥ bhante āgamehi iti vuccamānaḥ na āgamessati iti  atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantam upanandam sakya puttam aneka pariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesuṃ pe
translated: to do a service for him?”

original: “saccaṁ kira tvaṁ, upananda, upāsakena—
analyzed: saccam kira tvam upananda upāsakena
translated: After rebuking him in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:

original: ‘ajjaṇho, bhante, āgamehī’ti vuccamāno nāgamesī”ti?
analyzed: ajjaṇhaḥ bhante āgamehi iti vuccamānaḥ na āgamesi iti
translated: “Is it true, Upananda, that you did this?”

original: “Saccaṁ, bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: sat ca bhagavān ati
translated: “It’s true, Sir.”

original: Vigarahi buddho bhagavā …pe…
analyzed: vigarahi buddhaḥ bhagavān pe
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, rebuked them, …

original: kathañhi nāma tvaṁ, moghapurisa, upāsakena—
analyzed: kathañhi nāma tva moghapurisaḥ upāsakena
translated: “How could you act in this way?

original: ‘ajjaṇho, bhante, āgamehī’ti vuccamāno nāgamessasi.
analyzed: ajjaṇhaḥ bhante āgamehi iti vuccamānaḥ na āgamessasi
translated: When told by a lay follower, ‘Sir, please wait until tomorrow,’ to not wait.

original: Netaṁ, moghapurisa, appasannānaṁ vā pasādāya …pe…
analyzed: neta moghapurisa appasannānam vā pasādāya pe
translated: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …

original: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ uddiseyyātha—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave imam sikkhāpadam uddiseyyātha
translated: “And, monks, this is how you should recite this training rule:

original: “Bhikkhuṁ paneva uddissa rājā vā rājabhoggo vā brāhmaṇo vā gahapatiko vā dūtena cīvaracetāpannaṁ pahiṇeyya—
analyzed: bhikkhum pana iva uddissa rājā vā rājabhoggaḥ vā brāhmaṇaḥ vā gahapatikaḥ vā dūtena cīvara cetāpannam pahiṇeyya
translated: ‘If a king, a royal minister, a brahmin, or a householder sends a messenger to a monk, saying,

original: ‘iminā cīvaracetāpannena cīvaraṁ cetāpetvā itthannāmaṁ bhikkhuṁ cīvarena acchādehī’ti.
analyzed: iminā cīvara cetāpannena cīvaram cetāpetvā itthannāmam bhikkhum cīvarena acchādehi iti
translated: “Sir, please accept this robe-cloth fund. Use it to buy robe-cloth for so-and-so,”

original: So ce dūto taṁ bhikkhuṁ upasaṅkamitvā evaṁ vadeyya—
analyzed: saḥ ce dūto tam bhikkhum upasaṅkamitvā evam vadeyya
translated: and if that messenger, on arriving at that monk’s dwelling place, says,

original: ‘idaṁ kho, bhante, āyasmantaṁ uddissa cīvaracetāpannaṁ ābhataṁ, paṭiggaṇhātu āyasmā cīvaracetāpannan’ti,
analyzed: idam kho bhante āyasmantam uddissa cīvara cetā āpannam ābhata paṭiggaṇhātu āyasmā cīvara cetā āpannam ti
translated: “Sir, this robe-cloth fund has been brought for you. Please accept it,”

original: tena bhikkhunā so dūto evamassa vacanīyo—
analyzed: tena bhikkhunā saḥ dūtaḥ evam assa vacanīyaḥ
translated: then that monk should say to that messenger,

original: ‘na kho mayaṁ, āvuso, cīvaracetāpannaṁ paṭiggaṇhāma. Cīvarañca kho mayaṁ paṭiggaṇhāma, kālena kappiyan’ti.
analyzed: na kho maye āvuso cīvara cetāpannam paṭiggaṇhāma cīvaram ca kho mayam paṭiggaṇhāma kālena kappiyanti
translated: ‘We don’t accept cloth on credit, but we do accept cloth that’s ready for use.’

original: So ce dūto taṁ bhikkhuṁ evaṁ vadeyya—
analyzed: saḥ ce dūto tam bhikkhum evam vadeyya
translated: If the messenger says,

original: ‘atthi panāyasmato koci veyyāvaccakaro’ti,
analyzed: atthi pana āyasmataḥ koci
translated: ‘But does he have anyone who can act for him?’

original: cīvaratthikena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā veyyāvaccakaro niddisitabbo ārāmiko vā upāsako vā—
analyzed: cīvaratthikena bhikkhave bhikkhunā veyyāvacca karaḥ niddisitabbaḥ ārāmikaḥ vā upāsakaḥ vā
translated: then the monk who needs the robe should point out someone who can act for him, either a monastery worker or a lay follower.

original: ‘eso kho, āvuso, bhikkhūnaṁ veyyāvaccakaro’ti.
analyzed: esaḥ kho āvuso bhikkhūnam veyyāvaccakaroti
translated: ‘He’s the one who can act for the monks.’

original: So ce dūto taṁ veyyāvaccakaraṁ saññāpetvā taṁ bhikkhuṁ upasaṅkamitvā evaṁ vadeyya—
analyzed: saḥ ce dūto tam veyyāvaccakaram saññāpetvā tam bhikkhum upasaṅkamitvā evam vadeyya
translated: If the messenger then makes an agreement with that person and returns to the monk, saying,

original: ‘yaṁ kho, bhante, āyasmā veyyāvaccakaraṁ niddisi saññatto so mayā, upasaṅkamatu āyasmā kālena, cīvarena taṁ acchādessatī’ti,
analyzed: yam kho bhante āyasmā veyyāvaccakaram niddisi saññattaḥ saḥ mayā upasaṅkamatu āyasmā kālena cīvarena tam acchādessati iti
translated: ‘Venerable, I’ve made an agreement with the one who can act for you. Please come at the appropriate time, and he’ll give you a robe,’

original: cīvaratthikena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā veyyāvaccakaro upasaṅkamitvā dvattikkhattuṁ codetabbo sāretabbo—
analyzed: cīvaratthikena bhikkhave bhikkhunā veyyāvacca karo upasaṅkamitvā dvatti khattum codetabbo sāretabbo
translated: then the monk who needs the robe should approach that person and remind him of the agreement up to twenty-eight times:

original: ‘attho me, āvuso, cīvarenā’ti.
analyzed: atthaḥ me āvuso cīvarena ati
translated: ‘I need a robe.’

original: Dvattikkhattuṁ codayamāno sārayamāno taṁ cīvaraṁ abhinipphādeyya, iccetaṁ kusalaṁ;
analyzed: dvattikkhattum codayamānaḥ sārayamānaḥ tam cīvaram abhinipphādeyya icca etam kusala
translated: If, by pressing and reminding him twenty times, he gets that robe made, that’s good.

original: no ce abhinipphādeyya, catukkhattuṁ pañcakkhattuṁ chakkhattuparamaṁ tuṇhībhūtena uddissa ṭhātabbaṁ.
analyzed: no ce abhinipphādeyya catu khattum pañca khattum cha khattu paramam tuṇhībhūtena uddissa ṭhātabba
translated: If he doesn’t get it made, he should stand there silently, directing his mind to the robe, for four, five, or six hours at the most.

original: Catukkhattuṁ pañcakkhattuṁ chakkhattuparamaṁ tuṇhībhūto uddissa tiṭṭhamāno taṁ cīvaraṁ abhinipphādeyya, iccetaṁ kusalaṁ;🔽tato ce uttari vāyamamāno taṁ cīvaraṁ abhinipphādeyya, nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.
analyzed: catu khattum pañca khattum cha khattu paramam tuṇhībhūtaḥ uddissa tiṭṭhamānaḥ tam cīvaram abhinipphādeyya icca etam kusala  tatas ce uttari vā āyamamānaḥ tam cīvaram abhinipphādeyya nissaggiyam pācittiya
translated: If, by standing there silently directing his mind to the robe for four, five, or six hours, he gets that robe made, that’s good.🔽If he gets it made by making further effort, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: No ce abhinipphādeyya, yatassa cīvaracetāpannaṁ ābhataṁ, tattha sāmaṁ vā gantabbaṁ dūto vā pāhetabbo—
analyzed: no ce yatassa cīvara cetā āpannam tattha sāmam vā gantabbam dūtaḥ vā pāhetabbaḥ
translated: If he doesn’t get it made, he should either go there himself or send a message,

original: ‘yaṁ kho tumhe āyasmanto bhikkhuṁ uddissa cīvaracetāpannaṁ pahiṇittha, na taṁ tassa bhikkhuno kiñci atthaṁ anubhoti,
analyzed: yam kho tumhe āyasmantaḥ bhikkhum uddissa cīvara cetāpannam pahiṇittha na tam tassa bhikkhuno kiñci attham anubhoti
translated: saying, ‘Venerables, the robe-cloth that you sent for a monk is not benefiting him in any way.

original: yuñjantāyasmanto sakaṁ, mā vo sakaṁ vinassā’ti,
analyzed: yuñjanta ayasmantaḥ saka mā vaḥ sakam vinassāti
translated: You should take it back. Don’t let it be lost.’

original: ayaṁ tattha sāmīcī”ti.
analyzed: ayam sāmīcī iti
translated: This is the proper conduct in this case.”

original: Bhikkhuṁ paneva uddissāti
analyzed: bhikkhum pana iva uddissa ati
translated: If a monk:

original: bhikkhussatthāya, bhikkhuṁ ārammaṇaṁ karitvā, bhikkhuṁ acchādetukāmo.
analyzed: bhikkhuḥ satthāya bhikkhum ārammaṇam karitvā bhikkhum a chādetu kāmo
translated: for the benefit of a monk, for the sake of a monk, wanting to give to a monk.

original: Rājā nāma
analyzed: rājā nāma
translated: A king:

original: yo koci rajjaṁ kāreti.
analyzed: yaḥ koci rajjam kāra iti
translated: anyone who rules over a country.

original: Rājabhoggo nāma
analyzed: rājabhoggaḥ nāma
translated: A royal official:

original: yo koci rañño bhattavetanāhāro.🔽Brāhmaṇo nāma
analyzed: yaḥ koci raññaḥ bhatta vetana āhāraḥ  brāhmaṇaḥ nāma
translated: anyone who is supported by the king.🔽A brahmin:

original: jātiyā brāhmaṇo.
analyzed: jātiyā brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: a person born into the brahmin caste.

original: Gahapatiko nāma🔽ṭhapetvā rājaṁ rājabhoggaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ avaseso gahapatiko nāma.
analyzed: gahapatikaḥ nāma  ṭhapetvā rājam rājabhoggam brāhmaṇam avasesaḥ gahapatikaḥ nāma
translated: A householder:🔽anyone who is not a king, a royal official, or a brahmin.

original: Cīvaracetāpannaṁ nāma
analyzed: cīvaracetāpannam nāma
translated: A monetary gift for robe-cloth:

original: hiraññaṁ vā suvaṇṇaṁ vā muttā vā maṇi vā.
analyzed: hiraññam vā suvaṇṇam vā muttā vā maṇi vā
translated: gold, silver, pearls, or gemstones.

original: Iminā cīvaracetāpannenāti
analyzed: iminā cīvara cetā āpannena ati
translated: With this monetary gift for robe-cloth:

original: paccupaṭṭhitena.🔽Cetāpetvāti
analyzed: paccupaṭṭhitena  ceta apetvā ati
translated: with what has been offered.🔽After bartering:

original: parivattetvā.🔽Acchādehīti
analyzed: parivattetvā  acchādehi iti
translated: after exchanging.🔽Give it to him:

original: dajjehi.
analyzed: dajjehi
translated: give it to him.

original: So ce dūto taṁ bhikkhuṁ upasaṅkamitvā evaṁ vadeyya—
analyzed: saḥ ce dūto tam bhikkhum upasaṅkamitvā evam vadeyya
translated: If that messenger, after approaching that monk, says,

original: “idaṁ kho, bhante, āyasmantaṁ uddissa cīvaracetāpannaṁ ābhataṁ. Paṭiggaṇhātu āyasmā cīvaracetāpannan”ti,
analyzed: idam kho bhante āyasmantam uddissa cīvara cetā āpannam ābhata paṭiggaṇhātu āyasmā cīvara cetā āpannam ti
translated: “Venerable, this monetary gift for robe-cloth has been brought for you. Please accept it,”

original: tena bhikkhunā so dūto evamassa vacanīyo—
analyzed: tena bhikkhunā saḥ dūtaḥ evam assa vacanīyaḥ
translated: then that monk should say to that messenger,🔽“We don’t accept monetary gifts for robe-cloth, but we do accept robe-cloth.”

original: “na kho mayaṁ, āvuso, cīvaracetāpannaṁ paṭiggaṇhāma. Cīvarañca kho mayaṁ paṭiggaṇhāma, kālena kappiyan”ti.
analyzed: na kho maye āvuso cīvara cetāpannam paṭiggaṇhāma cīvaram ca kho mayam paṭiggaṇhāma kālena kappiyanti
translated: “We don’t accept cloth on credit. But we’ll accept cloth if it’s appropriate to the time.”

original: So ce dūto taṁ bhikkhuṁ evaṁ vadeyya—
analyzed: saḥ ce dūto tam bhikkhum evam vadeyya
translated: If the messenger says to that monk,

original: “atthi panāyasmato koci veyyāvaccakaro”ti?
analyzed: atthi pana āyasmataḥ koci
translated: “But who will be responsible for the cloth?”

original: Cīvaratthikena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā veyyāvaccakaro niddisitabbo ārāmiko vā upāsako vā—
analyzed: cīvaratthikena bhikkhave bhikkhunā veyyāvacca karaḥ niddisitabbaḥ ārāmikaḥ vā upāsakaḥ vā
translated: “A monk who needs robe-cloth should point out a responsible person—a monastery worker or a lay follower—

original: “eso kho, āvuso, bhikkhūnaṁ veyyāvaccakaro”ti.
analyzed: esaḥ kho āvuso bhikkhūnam veyyāvaccakaroti
translated: saying, ‘He’s responsible for the monks’ robe-cloth.’

original: Na vattabbo— “tassa dehīti vā, so vā nikkhipissati, so vā parivattessati, so vā cetāpessatī”ti.
analyzed: na vattabbo tassa dehi iti vā saḥ vā nikkhipissati saḥ vā parivattessati saḥ vā cetāpessati iti
translated: He shouldn’t say, ‘Give it to him’ or ‘He’ll store it’ or ‘He’ll exchange it’ or ‘He’ll choose it.’”

original: So ce dūto taṁ veyyāvaccakaraṁ saññāpetvā taṁ bhikkhuṁ upasaṅkamitvā evaṁ vadeyya—
analyzed: saḥ ce dūto tam veyyāvaccakaram saññāpetvā tam bhikkhum upasaṅkamitvā evam vadeyya
translated: If the messenger has the responsible person agree, and then says to that monk,

original: “yaṁ kho, bhante, āyasmā veyyāvaccakaraṁ niddisi saññatto so mayā. Upasaṅkamatu āyasmā kālena, cīvarena taṁ acchādessatī”ti.
analyzed: yam kho bhante āyasmā veyyāvaccakaram niddisi saññattaḥ saḥ mayā upasaṅkamatu āyasmā kālena cīvarena tam acchādessati iti
translated: “Venerable, I’ve had the responsible person agree. Please come at the appropriate time, and he’ll give you robe-cloth.”

original: Cīvaratthikena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā veyyāvaccakaro upasaṅkamitvā dvattikkhattuṁ codetabbo sāretabbo—
analyzed: cīvaratthikena bhikkhave bhikkhunā veyyāvacca karo upasaṅkamitvā dvatti khattum codetabbo sāretabbo
translated: If a monk who needs a robe goes to the one who does the assigning and reminds him of the need for the robe, he should do so up to three times.

original: “attho me, āvuso, cīvarenā”ti.
analyzed: atthaḥ me āvuso cīvarena ati
translated: “I need a robe.”

original: Na vattabbo— “dehi me cīvaraṁ, āhara me cīvaraṁ, parivattehi me cīvaraṁ, cetāpehi me cīvaran”ti.🔽Dutiyampi vattabbo.
analyzed: na vattabbaḥ dehi me cīvara āhara me cīvara parivattehi me cīvara cetāpehi me cīvara nti  dutiyam pi vattabbaḥ
translated: He shouldn’t say, “Give me a robe. Bring me a robe. Exchange this robe for me. Get this robe for me.”

original: Tatiyampi vattabbo.
analyzed: tatiyam pi vattabbaḥ
translated: He should remind him a second and a third time.

original: Sace abhinipphādeti, iccetaṁ kusalaṁ;
analyzed: sace abhinipphāda iti icca itam kusala
translated: If he gets it, all is well.

original: no ce abhinipphādeti, tattha gantvā tuṇhībhūtena uddissa ṭhātabbaṁ.
analyzed: no ce abhinipphādeti tattha gantvā tuṇhībhūtena uddissa ṭhātabba
translated: If not, he should go there and remain silent, standing in the right place.

original: Na āsane nisīditabbaṁ. Na āmisaṁ paṭiggahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: na āsane nisīditabba na āmisam paṭiggahetabba
translated: He shouldn’t sit down on a seat. He shouldn’t receive staple or non-staple food.

original: Na dhammo bhāsitabbo.
analyzed: na dhammaḥ bhāsitabbaḥ
translated: He shouldn’t give a teaching.

original: “Kiṁ kāraṇā āgatosī”ti pucchiyamāno “jānāhi, āvuso”ti vattabbo.
analyzed: kim kāraṇā āgataḥ asi iti pucchiyamānaḥ jānāhi āvuso ti vattabbo
translated: If asked, “Why have you come?” he should say, “You know.”

original: Sace āsane vā nisīdati, āmisaṁ vā paṭiggaṇhāti, dhammaṁ vā bhāsati, ṭhānaṁ bhañjati.🔽Dutiyampi ṭhātabbaṁ.
analyzed: sace āsane vā nisīdati āmisam vā paṭiggaṇhāti dhammam vā bhāsati ṭhānam bhañjati  dutiyam pi
translated: If he sits down on a seat, receives staple or non-staple food, or gives a teaching, he loses the right to remind.

original: Tatiyampi ṭhātabbaṁ.🔽Catukkhattuṁ codetvā catukkhattuṁ ṭhātabbaṁ.
analyzed: tatiyam pi 🔽catu khattum codetvā catu khattum
translated: He should remind a second and a third time.🔽He should stand there for a second and a third time.🔽He should remind up to four times and stand there for up to four times.

original: Pañcakkhattuṁ codetvā dvikkhattuṁ ṭhātabbaṁ.
analyzed: pañca kkhattum codetvā dvi kkhattum
translated: After pressing him a fifth time, he should wait two days.

original: Chakkhattuṁ codetvā na ṭhātabbaṁ.
analyzed: chakkhattum codetvā na ṭhātabba
translated: After pressing him a sixth time, he should not wait.

original: Tato ce uttari vāyamamāno taṁ cīvaraṁ abhinipphādeti,🔽payoge dukkaṭaṁ.
analyzed: tatas ce uttari vā āyamamānaḥ tam cīvaram abhinipphādeti  payoge dukkaṭa
translated: If, after that, he makes an effort and obtains robe-cloth,🔽then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

original: Paṭilābhena nissaggiyaṁ hoti.
analyzed: paṭilābhena nissaggiyam hoti
translated: When he gets it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

original: Nissajjitabbaṁ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā.
analyzed: nissajjitabbam saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā
translated: It should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, nissajjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave
translated: And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.

original: …pe…
analyzed: pe

original: “idaṁ me, bhante, cīvaraṁ atirekatikkhattuṁ codanāya atirekachakkhattuṁ ṭhānena abhinipphāditaṁ nissaggiyaṁ.
analyzed: idam me bhante cīvaram atireka tikkhattum codanāya atireka chakkhattum ṭhānena abhinipphāditam nissaggiya
translated: ‘Venerables, this robe-cloth, which I obtained after pressing him more than three times and waiting more than two days, is to be relinquished.

original: Imāhaṁ saṅghassa nissajjāmī”ti …pe…🔽dadeyyāti …pe…🔽dadeyyunti …pe…
analyzed: imā aham saṅghassa nissajjāmi iti pe  dadeyyā ati pe  pe
translated: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …🔽‘Give it to a sangha …’ …🔽‘Give it to a group …’ …

original: āyasmato dammīti.
analyzed: āyasmataḥ dammi iti
translated: ‘I give it to you.’”

original: No ce abhinipphādeyya, yatassa cīvaracetāpannaṁ ābhataṁ tattha sāmaṁ vā gantabbaṁ dūto vā pāhetabbo—
analyzed: no ce yatassa cīvara cetā āpannam ābhatam tattha sāmam vā gantabbam dūtaḥ vā pāhetabbaḥ
translated: If he does not obtain robe-cloth, he should either go to that place himself or send a message,

original: “yaṁ kho tumhe, āyasmanto, bhikkhuṁ uddissa cīvaracetāpannaṁ pahiṇittha na taṁ tassa bhikkhuno kiñci atthaṁ anubhoti.
analyzed: yam kho tumhe āyasmantaḥ bhikkhum uddissa cīvara cetāpannam pahiṇittha na tam tassa bhikkhuno kiñci attham anubhoti
translated: saying, ‘Venerables, the robe-cloth that you sent to that monk is of no benefit to him.

original: Yuñjantāyasmanto sakaṁ, mā vo sakaṁ vinassā”ti.🔽Ayaṁ tattha sāmīcīti
analyzed: yuñjanta ayasmantaḥ saka mā vaḥ sakam vinassāti  ayam sāmīcī iti
translated: You should apply yourselves to your own affairs, so that your own affairs don’t get lost.”🔽This is the proper conduct here.

original: ayaṁ tattha anudhammatā.
analyzed: ayam tattha anudhamma tā
translated: This is the right way to do it.

original: Atirekatikkhattuṁ codanāya atirekachakkhattuṁ ṭhānena atirekasaññī abhinipphādeti, nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.🔽Atirekatikkhattuṁ codanāya atirekachakkhattuṁ ṭhānena vematiko abhinipphādeti, nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.🔽Atirekatikkhattuṁ codanāya atirekachakkhattuṁ ṭhānena ūnakasaññī abhinipphādeti, nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.
analyzed: atireka tikkhattum codanāya atireka chakkhattum ṭhānena atireka saññī abhinipphādeti nissaggiyam pācittiya  atireka tikkhattum codanāya atireka cha khattum ṭhānena vematikaḥ abhinipphādeti nissaggiyam pācittiya  atireka tikkhattum codanāya atireka chakkhattum ṭhānena ūnaka saññī abhinipphādeti nissaggiyam pācittiya
translated: If, after more than three requests and more than four attempts, he perceives it as more, and he makes her do it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽If, after more than three requests and more than four attempts, he is unsure of it, and he makes her do it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽If, after more than three requests and more than four attempts, he perceives it as less, and he makes her do it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: Ūnakatikkhattuṁ codanāya ūnakachakkhattuṁ ṭhānena atirekasaññī, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Ūnakatikkhattuṁ codanāya ūnakachakkhattuṁ ṭhānena vematiko, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: ūnaka tikkhattum codanāya ūnaka chakkhattum ṭhānena atireka saññī āpatti dukkaṭassa  ūnaka tikkhattum codanāya ūnaka cha khattum ṭhānena vematikaḥ āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If, after fewer than three requests and fewer than four attempts, he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If, after fewer than three requests and fewer than four attempts, he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Ūnakatikkhattuṁ codanāya ūnakachakkhattuṁ ṭhānena ūnakasaññī anāpatti.
analyzed: ūnaka tikkhattum codanāya ūnaka chakkhattum ṭhānena ūnaka saññī anāpatti
translated: If, after fewer than three requests and fewer than four attempts, he perceives it as less, there is no offense.

original: Anāpatti—
analyzed: anāpatti
translated: There is no offense if

original: tikkhattuṁ codanāya, chakkhattuṁ ṭhānena,
analyzed: tikkhattum codanāya chakkhattum ṭhānena
translated: she is asked three times and attempts four times,

original: ūnakatikkhattuṁ codanāya, ūnakachakkhattuṁ ṭhānena,
analyzed: ūnaka tikkhattum codanāya ūnaka chakkhattum ṭhānena
translated: If he gives it after less than three reminders and less than six adjournments;

original: acodiyamāno deti,
analyzed: a codiyamānaḥ deti
translated: if he gives it without being reminded;

original: sāmikā codetvā denti,
analyzed: sāmikā ca udetvā denti
translated: if the owners remind him and then give it;

original: ummattakassa,
analyzed: ummattakassa
translated: if he is insane;

original: ādikammikassāti.🔽Rājasikkhāpadaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ dasamaṁ.🔽Kathinavaggo paṭhamo.
analyzed: ādikammikassa ati  rāja sikkhāpadam niṭṭhitam dasama  kathina vaggo paṭhamaḥ
translated: if he is the first offender.🔽The training rule on kings, the tenth, is finished.

original: Tassuddānaṁ
analyzed: tassa uddāna
translated: The first sub-chapter on the robe-making ceremony is finished.🔽The summary:

original: Ubbhataṁ kathinaṁ tīṇi,
analyzed: ubbhatam kathinam tīṇi
translated: Taken up, robe-making ceremony, three,

original: dhovanañca paṭiggaho;
analyzed: dhovanam ca paṭiggaho
translated: and washing, and receiving;

original: Aññātakāni tīṇeva,
analyzed: aññātakāni tīṇi iva
translated: Three on unrelated people,

original: ubhinnaṁ dūtakena cāti.
analyzed: ubhinnam dūtakena ca ati
translated: and both, and a messenger.
